intro: Senecio antofagastanus, commonly known as the Antofagasta groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Senecio antofagastanus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native environment.
